org.ejml.alg.dense.decomposition.svd
Class SingularValueDecompositionBase

java.lang.Object
  org.ejml.alg.dense.decomposition.svd.SingularValueDecompositionBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
DecompositionInterface, SingularValueDecomposition
Direct Known Subclasses:
SvdNumericalRecipes
public abstract class SingularValueDecompositionBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements SingularValueDecomposition

This is an abstract class for singular value decomposition (SVD) algorithms. It provides common data structures and a generic interface for using the results. Any child of this class will compute the SVD of A:

A = U * W * V T

where A is m by n, and U,W,V are all n by n. U and V are orthogonal matrices. W is a diagonal matrix.

The inverse from SVD is computed as follows:

A-1=V*[diag(1/wj)]*UT

Author:
Peter Abeles
See Also:
SvdNumericalRecipes

setExpectedMaxSize

public void setExpectedMaxSize(int numRows,
                               int numCols)
Description copied from interface: DecompositionInterface
Declares internal data structures such that new memory will not need to declared if a matrix is decomposed that is less than or equal to the specified shape.

Specified by:
setExpectedMaxSize in interface DecompositionInterface
Parameters:
numRows - Matrices are expected to have less than or equal to this number of rows.
numCols - Matrices are expected to have less than or equal to this number of columns.

decompose

public abstract boolean decompose(DenseMatrix64F mat)
Performs SVD on the specified matrix. This function must be called first before many of the other functions will function correctly.

Specified by:
decompose in interface DecompositionInterface
Parameters:
mat - The m by n matrix that SVD is to be performed on. Not modified.
Returns:
True if it was able to decompose the matrix, false otherwise.
